name: SCAMPER
description: A creative thinking technique that uses a set of directed questions to help generate new ideas or improve existing ones.

steps.title: Select subject
steps.description: Choose a product, service or process to improve

steps.title: Apply SCAMPER questions
steps.description: Use each letter of SCAMPER as a prompt for brainstorming: Substitute, Combine, Adapt, Modify, Put to other uses, Eliminate, Reverse

steps.title: Record ideas
steps.description: Document all ideas generated

steps.title: Evaluate and refine
steps.description: Review, combine and improve promising ideas

tips: Encourage wild ideas during the process
Focus on quantity over quality initially

name: Customer Journey Mapping
description: A visualization technique that maps out the story of a customer's experience with your product or service across all touchpoints.

steps.title: Define scope and personas
steps.description: Identify which customer journey to map and create relevant personas

steps.title: List touchpoints
steps.description: Identify all interactions between customer and organization

steps.title: Map current journey
steps.description: Plot the current journey with actions, emotions, and pain points

steps.title: Analyze and identify opportunities
steps.description: Look for pain points and areas for improvement

steps.title: Design improved journey
steps.description: Create an improved future state customer journey

tips: Use real customer data when possible
Include customer emotions at each stage

references.title: How to Create a Customer Journey Map

name: Value Proposition Canvas
description: A framework to ensure a product or service is positioned around what the customer values and needs.

steps.title: Define customer segment
steps.description: Identify the specific customer segment you're creating value for

steps.title: Map customer profile
steps.description: Document customer jobs, pains, and gains

steps.title: Create value map
steps.description: Define your products/services, pain relievers, and gain creators

steps.title: Achieve fit
steps.description: Analyze how your value map addresses the customer profile

steps.title: Refine and iterate
steps.description: Adjust your value proposition based on the analysis

tips: Focus on one customer segment at a time
Be specific about customer jobs, pains, and gains
Test your assumptions with real customers

name: Design Sprint
description: A five-day process for solving problems and testing new ideas through design, prototyping, and testing with customers.

steps.title: Understand
steps.description: Map out the problem and pick an important area to focus on

steps.title: Diverge
steps.description: Sketch competing solutions on paper

steps.title: Decide
steps.description: Make decisions and turn ideas into a testable hypothesis

steps.title: Prototype
steps.description: Build a realistic prototype

steps.title: Validate
steps.description: Test with real users

tips: Block all five days with no interruptions
Include diverse perspectives in your team
Focus on a specific, important challenge
Build just enough of a prototype to test

name: Empathy Mapping
description: A collaborative visualization used to articulate what we know about a particular type of user.

steps.title: Define user
steps.description: Identify the user or persona for the empathy map

steps.title: Map what they say
steps.description: Document what the user says out loud in interviews or public settings

steps.title: Map what they think
steps.description: Capture what the user might be thinking but not explicitly saying

steps.title: Map what they do
steps.description: Note the actions and behaviors the user takes

steps.title: Map what they feel
steps.description: Document the user's emotional state or what they might be feeling

steps.title: Identify pain points and gains
steps.description: Summarize the user's challenges and desires

tips: Use real user research when possible
Focus on one user type at a time
Update the map as you learn more

references.title: Empathy Map - Why and How to Use It
